III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10155 Recreational activities.
Section (1) Written policy and procedure shall provide a recreation and
Description leisure time plan that includes at least 1 hour per day of large
muscle activity and 1 hour of leisure time activities.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has not been getting his 45 minute of daily large muscle
activity for the past week.
Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 5/29/2025. Staff 1 was asked about the lack of
big muscle activity by Youth A, Staff 1 reported Youth A is in a
room/pod program because his interactions with others have been
negative. Youth A has a tendency to threaten other youth and
once Youth A is able to interact with others appropriately, he will
have this room/pod program. Each day Youth A is evaluated to
determine if he can be out of his room. Staff 1 reported Youth A is
provided 1-hour each day for exercise. Staff 1 reported Supervisor
1 will take Youth A to the gym as long as Youth A is not
threatening others. Staff 1 reported over the last two days; staff
get Youth A up but once he begins to threaten others he must
return to his room.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 5/29/2025. Staff 2 reported Youth A is on a
room/pod program because he is “unpredictable and threatens
others in a violent way”. She reported Youth A is allowed 1-hour
out of his room each day and is evaluated daily to see if he is
ready to join the rest of the pod out of his room. The program only
lasts as long as Youth A’s choices are to respond in a threatening
manner.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS
Worker at the facility on 5/29/2025. When asked about the room
program and large muscle exercise for Youth A, Supervisor 1
responded with Youth A is getting large muscle exercise because
he is allowed out of his room for an hour each day. Supervisor 1
stated, “I took him to the gym on Friday and Saturday because he
was doing better. His time in his room is only because he is
threatening others when in the general program. The more
positive behaviors he shows the more time he has out of his
2

room”. Supervisor 2 reported time out and time in Youth A’s room
is documented on the “green sheet”.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face with MDHHS Worker at
the facility on 5/29/2025. Youth A declined and refused to speak
any further or address the issue of getting activities out of Youth
A’s room.
Complainant was anonymous.
Documents Reviewed:
Room Observation Sheet Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home
starting on 5/22/25 for Youth A. Documentation indicates Youth
A was observed by staff within the guidelines for observations of a
youth in their room. It is documented Youth A was out of his room
twice during the day, once for an activity and then for visitation.
The reason for the room confinement is documented as “Status A
Pod Program”.
Room Observation Sheet Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home
starting on 5/23/25 for Youth A. Documentation indicates Youth
A’s reason for confinement is “Status A pod Program”. The time
begins at 7:42 am and ends at 6:30 pm. It is documented that
Youth A was out of his room twice with one time being a visit to
the medication bus and the other activity. Rooms checks are
documented as variable but within the 15-minute time
requirement. Documentation indicates Youth A was out of his
room for an activity from 7:42 am to 9:00 am.
Room Observation Sheet Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home
starting on 5/24/25 for Youth A. Documentation of observations
in Youth A’s room begin at 8:30 am and end at 8:30 pm. All
checks are documented as interval and variable within the 15-
minute time requirement. It is documented Youth A was out of his
room for an activity beginning at 9:50 am until 10:50 am.
Documentation indicates Youth A’s reason for confinement is
“Status A pod Program”.
Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home Policy 4.7 Rules and
Discipline Resident Management/Resident Rights without a
date.
This document outlines the rights of youth in the program and
states that no youth shall be deprived of exercise (I hour large
muscle activity per day including Behavioral Programs.),
opportunity to bathe or shower daily, and proper sanitation.
3

Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home Policy 4.5 Room Confinement
without a date. It is documented that this policy is to reduce the
amount of room time for disciplinary reasons. It is stated that
youth in a room confinement shall continue to receive the services
provided other youth such as food, clothes, hygiene, and exercise
(large muscle activity).
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as evidenced by interviews with
staff and documents. The facility is using a program titled “Status
A pod Program” when youth are presenting with violent
aggression towards staff and other youth. The goal is to get them
out of their room as soon as possible but in a safe manner, thus
the youth controls their involvement in this program. Evidence
indicates even if the youth is still displaying violent behaviors, they
are taken out of their room for at least an hour per day to engage
in an activity.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures;
Section establishment.
Description Rule 107. A facility shall establish and follow written employment
policies and procedures that shall ensure that staff are emotionally
stable and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/16/25 or 5/17/25 Youth A and Supervisor 2 were arguing.
Youth A was not aggressive, nor did he initiate any physical
contact with Supervisor 2. Supervisor 2 became upset, swung on
Youth A and hit him in the face with his hand (it is unknown if it
was closed or open). Youth A and Supervisor 2 then began to
fight. The fight ended and Youth A said, "I am going to sue you
bitches". Supervisor 2 said, "You covered the camera dickhead,
there is no evidence". It is unknown if Youth A has any marks or
bruises.
Investigation Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 were interviewed face-to-
face with the MDHHS Worker at the facility on 5/29/2025. Both
reported being aware of the incident with Youth A and having
reviewed the video recording. They reported Youth A covered the
camera in the room with wet toilet paper which blocked any view
of the incident. Administrator 1 reported staff are never to be alone
with youth and Youth A became dysregulated when wanting a
phone call and not getting it quick enough. He reported Youth A
4

became aggressive and began throwing punches at Supervisor 2
and Staff 1 who were present in the room. Administrator 1
reported Supervisor 2 was in the process of bringing clean
blankets to Youth A because Youth A had thrown his food all over
the room causing the blanket to get wet. He reported Youth A was
placed into a restraint that became a mechanical restraint
because Youth A was trying to punch Supervisor 2 and Staff 1.
Administrator 2 (CPI instructor) reported the techniques used to
restrain Youth A were appropriate and he had no concerns.
Administrator 2 reported Supervisor 2 was backing up to avoid
physical contact with Youth A when Youth A lunged at Supervisor
2 to hit Supervisor 2.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 5/29/2025. He reported coming to work at 4 pm
and not knowing Youth A had been combative in court by throwing
a laptop and cursing and swearing at Central Control (Central
Control receives communication from youth when they press the
call button in their rooms) while in his room. He reported being
present in the hold room with Youth A and Supervisor 2 and
stated Supervisor 2 was talking with Youth A about the swearing
and threatening and Supervisor 2 would not be open to talk until
Youth A stopped swearing. Staff 1 reported Youth A said
Supervisor 2 was a good staff and Supervisor 2 informed Youth A,
Supervisor 2 would assist in helping make a phone call for Youth
A. He reported Youth A had thrown food over his room and made
a mess of the room. Staff 1 and Supervisor 2 were in the process
of cleaning out the room and Staff 1 reported bringing a new
blanket for Youth A. Staff 1 reported having a belief that
Supervisor 2 and Youth A had a good relationship but as
Supervisor 2 tried explaining the phone call process and how
Youth A can’t call a number without clearance, Youth A jumped up
and went aggressively at Supervisor 2. Staff 1 reported Youth A
took a swing at Supervisor 2 to put his arms out and hands up in a
blocking motion. Supervisor 2 denied striking Youth A in the face
or anywhere on Youth A’s body. Staff 1 reported Youth A went
from calm to “I’m going to kill you”, in a second. Because of Youth
A attempting to strike and hit staff, a restraint is appropriate and
must be conducted with two staff. Staff 1 reported this met the
requirements and Supervisor 2 and Staff 1 placed Youth A in a
standing hold and placed Youth A on the bench (bed). He
reported Supervisor 2 and himself didn’t know Youth A had
covered the camera in the room with toilet paper. Staff 1 denied
either Supervisor 2 or himself using any inappropriate language
during the incident. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 is a good staff
and never hearing that other staff have had an issue with
5

Supervisor 2. He reported never hearing that any youth have had
an issue with Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 2 does not have a
reputation for being unfair to youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 5/29/2025. She reported working in Central
Control the day of the incident and was able to observe a part of
the restraint from the camera in the hallway. She reported Youth A
covered the camera in his room with wet toilet paper. She
reported Central Control operates all doors and is responsible to
respond to youth when they push the button in their rooms to
communicate (medical or other issues) with staff. Staff 2 reported
Youth A was in his room and called for a supervisor while kicking
the door, cursing out staff along with Staff 2. Youth A called Staff 2
a “fuck you stupid whore bitch” because he believed Staff 2 was
not calling the supervisor and said this at least “30 times”. Staff 2
reported contacting Supervisor 2 who was in the process of
passing medication and Supervisor 2 informed Staff 2 he would go
to Youth A as soon as he completed the medication passing. Staff
2 observed and heard Supervisor 2 beginning to speak to Youth
A. She gave the same report as Staff 1 that Supervisor 2 told
Youth A to stop cursing and Youth A began to calm down. Staff 2
was able to observe through the camera in the hallway and kept
an eye on the situation. She reported Youth A was sitting on the
bed before beginning to jump from the bed to the sink and back.
As Supervisor 2 came back to the room and started giving clean
blankets to Youth A, Youth A jumped up and tried to punch
Supervisor 2 in the face. Supervisor 2 blocked the punch and
Youth A sat back on the bed. Staff 2 reported calling a “level 1” (all
free staff are to respond) while Youth A was cursing at Supervisor
2 and Staff 1 and threatening to “beat their asses”. Staff 2
reported observing Supervisor 2 and Staff 1 engage in the
restraint because Youth A had attacked Supervisor 2. Both
Supervisor 2 and Staff 1 grabbed an arm and placed Youth A on
the bed while waiting for assistance from other staff responding to
the Level 1. Staff 2 reported the techniques used for the restraint
were appropriate in all aspects because “everything was by the
book”. Staff 2 denied observing any scratch on Youth A’s leg and
never observed Youth A getting hurt by staff but did report Youth
A had punched the window in the room earlier. Staff 2 reported
Supervisor 2 is a “great supervisor” who has everyone’s respect,
and all staff like him. She described Staff 1 in the same manner.
She reported Supervisor 2 has no history of aggression with youth
and the restraint was appropriate because Youth A was attacking
staff.
6

Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS
Worker at the facility on 5/29/2025. He reported not being
present during the restraint of Youth A in the holding room but
reported Supervisor 2 has a good relationship with no history of
aggression towards the youth. Supervisor 2 gets along well with
staff at the facility. He reported coming to work the day after the
incident and speaking with Youth A and finding Youth A without
any injuries although, Youth A did curse at Supervisor 1.
Supervisor 1 also reported Youth A never told Supervisor 1 that
Supervisor 2 had punched Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 5/29/2025. Youth A reported not knowing why
Supervisor 2 came to Youth A’s room the day of the incident and
reported just wanting to get out of the holding cell. Youth A
admitted to putting toilet paper on the camera in the room and
reported being bored in the room. Youth A admitted to throwing
the food around the room and jumping from the bed to the sink
several times. When asked for further details, Youth A declined
and refused to speak any further.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS
Worker at the facility on 6/2/2025. He reported receiving a call
from Central Control about the situation with Youth A swearing
over the intercom at Central Control. After finishing the medication
passing, Supervisor 2 went to the holding room of Youth A with
Staff 1 and observed trash thrown around the room including milk
and other food. He reported having a goal of talking with Youth A
to help him de-escalate while getting Youth A and the room
cleaned up so Youth A could go to bed. Supervisor 2 reported
Youth A was “ok” when Supervisor first went into the room and
Youth A told Supervisor 2 that Supervisor 2 was “a real dude” with
Supervisor 2 telling Youth A that Supervisor 2 was here to help.
Supervisor 2 reported everything was going well when Supervisor
2 and Staff 1 began to move things out of the room in an effort to
clean up the room when Youth A became dysregulated. Youth A
stood up, growled and said “I’m a real nigger” before charging
towards Supervisor 2 and trying to punch Supervisor 2. Supervisor
2 reported putting his hands up in a blocking motion to defend
himself when Youth A fell backwards after running into Supervisor
2’s hands. Supervisor 2 reported his CPI training “kicked in” and
he knew they were going to have to restrain Youth A. Youth A
then got up and hit Supervisor 2 in the neck with a punch as
Supervisor 2 grabbed Youth A to begin the restraint. Supervisor 2
reported both went to the bed with Youth A on top of Supervisor 2
before Supervisor 2 was able to flip over and get on top of Youth
7

A. Supervisor 2 reported he was constantly talking to Youth A in
an effort to de-escalate Youth A. Supervisor 2 reported holding
Youth A’s right arm while Staff 1 held the left arm when Staff 8
came into the room (responding to the Level 1) and held Youth A's
legs. Supervisor 2 also reported other staff came to the room
because of the Level 1 call but was unable to recall who all of the
staff responding were. Supervisor 2 denied that he nor Staff 1
tried to hit Youth A, nor did they say anything inappropriate
(dickhead) to Youth A. Supervisor 2 was asked about his
reputation and ability to get along with other staff and he reported
some staff are not happy and will challenge his authority as a
supervisor. He also reported telling these staff that they must
follow the rules, and these “three staff” said they struggle with his
authority because he makes them follow the rules. The three
identified staff are the three staff identified as telling Youth A that
Supervisor 2 is racist. He identified these staff as Staff 3, Staff 4
and Staff 5. Supervisor 2 reported being surprised at Youth A’s
response because he thought he had a good relationship with
Youth A and likes Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/2/2025. Youth B reported Supervisor 2 is a
“racist” because he calls African American youth “monkey”, and it
was reported. Youth B was unable to recall who reported this
incident, but the other witness left, and the incident occurred 3-
years ago. Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility and the
staff protect the youth. Youth B reported Staff 3 is telling youth
Supervisor 2 is a racist.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/2/2025. Youth C reported staff have done
nothing inappropriate at the facility. He denied having any issues
with Supervisor 2 nor Staff 1. Youth C also reported “some staff
like Staff 3” think Supervisor 2 is a racist but Youth C has never
observed it, and Supervisor 2 has always been fair. Youth C
reported feeling safe at the facility and staff help the youth.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/2/2025. Youth D reported observing nothing
racial from staff and that staff are “good and appropriate”. He also
reported a desire to follow the rules and “get out of here”. When
asked about Supervisor 2, he reported “that’s my homie”. Youth D
reported feeling safe at the facility.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/2/2025. Youth E reported staff are appropriate
8

and all restraints he has witnessed have been appropriate. He
also reported not disliking any of the supervisors and believes
they treat the youth “ok”. Youth E reported some staff (unable to
recall specific staff) say “other staff stink”.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS
Worker at the facility on 6/2/2025. She reported having limited
interactions with Supervisor 2 but that all of these interactions
have been positive. She reported never witnessing Supervisor 2
say or do any thing that could be racist and never heard or seen
Supervisor 2 being aggressive with youth. She reported feeling
very comfortable with Staff 1 as interacting with youth. She
reported not being present at the time of the allegations but has
no issues with either Supervisor 2 or Staff 1.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/2/2025. He reported staff should wait to get a
supervisor’s permission before engaging in a restraint even if the
youth is being aggressive towards the staff. He reported never
being in that type of situation. Staff 3 was asked about the
allegation of him talking to youth about other staff and suggested
that all staff talk about different staff at times. He reported getting
the allegations from Youth A because Staff 3 was not present and
receiving information from Staff 4 about what was said by
Supervisor 2. He also reported Staff 4 knows more about
Supervisor 2 than Staff 3 does and if more information is required
then Staff 4 should be interviewed. When asked again about
speaking to youth about Supervisor 2 being a racist, Staff 3
stated, “I never said he was and I'm not saying he is, or he is not’
before stating “they have said he was a racist” before
acknowledging that he doesn’t know who “they” are. Staff 3 then
reported Supervisor 2 has used the word “nigger” which make
Supervisor 2 a “100% racist according to Staff 3. Staff 3 was
unable to give any specifics about time, day, or situation of
Supervisor 2 using the word “nigger”. When asked why Staff 3 is
not reporting such incidents, Staff 3 reported being fearful of
administration because, “they will retaliate” but gave no details.
Staff 3 also denied knowing the process of being a mandated
reporter and when confronted on the fact that he was trained to be
a mandated reporter, Staff 3 gave the idea he would be retaliated
against.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/2/2025. He reported working the day of the
incident outlined in the allegations and when “running” to the
holding room observe Youth A in the mechanical restraint with
9

“Supervisor 2 standing over holding Youth A”. He reported Youth
A told Staff 4 that Youth A “swung” on Supervisor 2 and
“Supervisor 2 was aggressive with Youth A”. Youth A is reported
to have told Staff 4 that Supervisor 2 was “rude” to Youth A, but
Staff 4 had no more details about Supervisor 2 being rude. Staff 4
reported witnessing a bruise on Youth A’s cheek and arm but was
unable to identify which cheek or which arm, but did state Youth A
told Staff 4 it was from the restraint. Staff 4 was asked about the
allegation of Supervisor 2 being abusive, but Staff 4 reported
never witnessing any abuse by Supervisor 2 and has no issues
with Supervisor 2 as a supervisor. Staff 4 reported never
witnessing Staff 1 engage in physical abuse of youth. When asked
about Supervisor 2 being a racist, Staff 4 reported hearing this
from multiple staff but was unable to identify specific multiple staff
and reported never hearing Supervisor 2 make a racial remark.
Staff 4 also reported a supervisor must approve a restraint if a
youth is refusing directions from staff, but staff can initiate a
restraint if the youth punches a staff. Staff 4 reported never
restraining a youth. When asked about Staff 4 talking to Youth A
about Supervisor 2, Staff 4 denied doing so and stated, “I mind my
own business” and “don’t talk to kids about staff”.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face with the MDHHS Worker
at the facility on 6/2/2025. She reported not being present the
day of the allegations but hearing about it later. She reported
being told by Youth A that the bruise on his face was from a punch
by Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 2 was talking in a condensing
manner towards Youth A. Staff 5 reported “sometimes Supervisor
2 will treat white kids different than black kids and gives the black
kids more room time”. Staff 5 was unable to provide specific
examples of this. Staff 5 reported Staff 3 and Staff 4 have
witnessed this action but nothing specific was provided. She
reported never observing Supervisor 2 or Staff 1 being physically
abused to any youth. She reported staff are allowed to restrain a
youth if the youth attacks staff. When asked about talking to youth
about staff she reported staff should not be doing this but
“everyone does” and kids lie about staff all the time.
Staff 6 was interviewed with the MDHHS Worker via phone on
6/3/2025. He reported responding to the Level 1 call the day of the
allegations. When arriving to the holding area, Staff 6 observed
Youth A being held by Supervisor 2 and Staff 1. Youth A was
cursing at staff and Staff 6 reported clearing out the bedding from
the room along with removing other items in the room. Staff 6
reported being given the handcuffs and providing the handcuffs to
Supervisor 2 who placed them on Youth A who was laying on the
10

bed. Staff 6 reported Supervisor 2 handled the situation in a
professional manner and was using techniques approved for CPI.
Staff 6 reported observing Youth A and seeing no marks on Youth
A’s hands or face.
Staff 7 was interviewed with the MDHHS Worker via phone on
6/3/2025. He reported responding to the Level 1 call the day of the
allegations and when arriving at the holding room observed Youth
A yelling and screaming at staff. He observed Supervisor 2 and
Staff 1 restraining Youth A who was lying on the bed on his side
with his hands behind him. Staff were putting the handcuffs on
Youth A while holding Youth A down before moving Youth A to his
back. Staff 7 reported there was nothing inappropriate and
everything was completed by the book.
Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on 6/18/2025. He reported
responding to the Level 1 call and when entering the holding room
observed Youth A being held down on the bed with his knees on
the floor by Supervisor 2 (right arm) and Staff 1 (left arm). Staff 7
held Youth A’s legs because Youth A was kicking and pulling
away from staff. Staff 7 reported the restraint was appropriate and
staff were not being inappropriate in any manner.
Supervisor 4 was interviewed via phone on 6/18/2025. She
reported being the staff that checked in Youth A to the facility on
the day of the allegations. She reported Youth A had a scratch on
his leg near the knee and red marks on his wrists from the
handcuffs Law Enforcement used to transport Youth A. She
reported Youth A attempted to “walk up on Law Enforcement” but
Supervisor 4 stepped between them and Youth A back off. She
also reported having left the facility prior to the restraint in the
allegations and did not observe Youth A until several days later.
Staff 9 was interviewed via phone on 6/30/2025. He reported
receiving the Level 1 call and responding to the holding unit where
Youth A was lodged. Upon getting to the room, he observed Youth
A already in the mechanical restraint involving Supervisor 2, Staff
1 and Staff 8. He was unable to recall the other staff present but
did remember there were two or three other staff. Staff 9 reported
hearing Youth A swear and curse at Supervisor 2. Staff 9 reported
not engaging in the restraint but clearing the room because he
didn’t want staff to slip on the food on the floor. He reported the
staff engaged in the restraint were using appropriate techniques
and he found nothing wrong with the restraint.
Complainant was anonymous.
11

Video Review
There are two videos from two cameras. With the first view from
the camera in Youth A’s holding room. Youth A is observed
covering the camera, so the view is blocked.
The second video is a view of the entrance to the holding room
which is partially blocked by a white board blocking a direct view
of the room. Objects are observed on the floor. Supervisor 2 and
Staff 1 are observed coming into the hallway from the top with the
laundry cart. Staff 1 is standing in the hallway while Supervisor 2
opens the door to Youth A's hold room and stands in the doorway.
Staff 1 grabs the garbage can while Supervisor 2 appears to be
talking to Youth A. Supervisor 2 then walks into Youth A’s room
and comes back out before putting the garbage can in the room.
Supervisor 2 is standing in the doorway when Youth A gets up
quickly and goes towards Supervisor 2. Staff 1 then walks into the
room and movement is observed but because of the obstacles in
the way what is occurring is not clear. Staff 7 and Staff 8 enter the
holding hallway and going into the room. Staff 8 is holding Youth
A's feet. Staff 7 is observed pulling objects of the room. Staff 6 is
observed entering the room. Youth A is put on the ground and
handcuffs are observed. Three additional staff enter the hallway
and stand in the hallway and eventually Supervisor 2 comes out of
the cell.
Documents Reviewed:
Email from MDHHS Worker dated 5/26/25. It is documented that
MDHHS Worker interviewed Youth A to complete a verification of
well-being. It is documented Youth A gave similar information to
the allegations to MDHHS Worker with the exception of the
following information. It is documented Youth A informed MDHHS
Worker that Youth A “kind of likes Supervisor 2” since the incident
in the allegations. It is also documented that Youth A reported to
MDHHS Worker that Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 told Youth A that
Supervisor 2 “had done this kind of thing before with other youth”.
Youth A reported to MDHHS Worker that Staff 3 said Supervisor 2
would call other youth “niggers”.
Admission form 1 for Youth A dated 5/16/25. This document
outlines Youth A was admitted to the facility on 5/16/25 at 8:01 am
and received a medical screening. The only marks on Youth A
were a scrap on his left knee and red marks on his wrists. This
document is signed by Supervisor 4.
12

Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home policy 7.11 Emergency
Procedures use of Force without a date. This document
outlines appropriate uses of force with youth. The first level of
force available to staff is to use their hands to subdue unruly
juveniles, to separate participants in a fight, in self-defense and in
defending staff, juveniles or other persons. Restraint equipment is
intended to be used only as control measures and only when
necessary. Staff are to notify the superintendent/designee
immediately and a written incident report is to be completed no
later than the end of the shift.
Email from Supervisor 2 dated 5/16/25 at 10:23 pm. This
document outlines the incident and follows the report provided by
different staff. The restraint was initiated after Youth A became
aggressive with Supervisor 2 and mechanical restraints were used
for Youth A’s safety and staff’s safety. It is documented Youth A
had no injuries, and medical care was offered but refused by
Youth A. It is documented Youth A was placed on “status A room
program” until 5/19/25 for assaulting staff.
Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home Incident Report dated
5/16/25 and signed by Staff 1. This document outlines the
incident in the allegations. It is documented Supervisor 2 entered
the room and asked Youth A to clean up the room to which Youth
A is documented as saying “you’re trying to play me”. Youth A is
then documented as saying he was being held hostage against
his will and Supervisor 2 explained the room needed to be
cleaned so Youth A could have clean bedding. At this time, Youth
A jumped up and came after Supervisor 2 saying Youth A was
going to “whip Supervisor 2’s ass. Supervisor 2 is documented as
pushing (this was described in the interview as a blocking move
rather than a push) Youth A to protect himself before Youth A
